titleStmt.title: [Receipt] 1794 Sept. 30 [to John Sevier] / [signed by] William Blount et. al. : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Blount, William

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1794 Sept. 30 [to John Sevier] / [signed by] William Blount et. al.
bibl.author: Blount, William
bibl.note: This document is a receipt signed by Governor William Blount and others to allow John Sevier to receive payment for his attendance at a session of the General Assembly in Knoxville, Tennessee.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: Territory of the United States South of the river Ohio. Knoxville,

div1.p: General John Sevier, a member of the Legislation Council was allowed One Hundred and Twelve Dollars & Sixty Six & 2/3 cents for his services in travelling to attending at, and returning from a session of the General Assembly began at Knoxville Augt. 25, 1794, and ending this day.

add.p: 24 April 1795, then recd of Francis A. Ramsey Esqr forty four dollars in Cash and his assumption for the Ballance of the within term payable when he shall have recd so much public money as will amount to that Service
I assume the balance of the within to Joseph Anderson Esqr25th of Apr
